results.title: Here is Canada
results.creator_credit: Tony Ianzelo, Colin Low and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Viewers outside Canada, and Canadians themselves, here have the pleasure of looking at, understanding, and discovering the many facets of this vast land, presented in choice film footage that is at once informative, visually appealing, and absorbing.

results.title: Here comes the sun
results.creator_credit: Bastian Wimmer, Clayton J. Edwards and Image Associates
results.brief_description: Four solar energy experiments have been set up by the National Science Foundation in four different school buildings in four different parts of the United States. The systems are located in Virginia, Maryland, Massachussetts and Minnesota, each utilising a basic system, but with slight differences in each unit.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bastian Wimmer, Clayton J. Edwards and Image Associates

results.title: Hercules
results.creator_credit: Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: Based on the story by Hardie Gramatky published in 1940, the most modern of fire engines is forced into retirement because of automation. Illustrated by Hardie Gramatky.

results.title: Henry V: the Battle of Agincourt [study extract]
results.brief_description: Vividly presents the Battle of Agincourt, from Henry V by Shakespeare. The study extract shows the preparations for, and the actual fighting by, both infantry and cavalry with all its noise, colour and confusion.

results.title: Henry Moore
results.brief_description: An analysis of the work of the British sculptor, Henry Moore, and an interview with the artist himself. The film shows, in detail, a number of examples of his work and then follows all stages in the creation of a bronze statue commissioned for the Festival of Britain.

results.title: Henry Ford's America
results.creator_credit: Donald Brittain, Janet Leissner, Paul Wright, Roman Kroitor and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An inside look at the workings of the Ford Motor Company. Traces the history of the company using historical footage, and interviews with Henry Ford II and other company executives. Looks at the developing role of the car within American society. Script, Donald Brittain. Editing, Rosemarie Shapely and Les Halman. Images, Andreas Poulsson. Music, Art Phillips.

results.title: Henri Rousseau: le douanier (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Lo Duca, F Tavano and Ecrans Modernes
results.brief_description: Portrays the life of the French primitive painter, Henri Rousseau, as reflected in his paintings. The film discusses the “phenomenon of Rousseau” in the evolution of the art of painting, shows the life of his imagination and reviews his work according to its inner logic.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lo Duca, F Tavano and Ecrans Modernes

results.title: Henri Gaudier-Brzeska
results.brief_description: A documentary on the sculptures and drawings of the young Vorticist sculptor who was killed in World War I at the age of 23. The film emphasises Gaudier-Brzeska’s involvement with the Vorticist movement and Ezra Pound. Gaudier-Brzeska’s statements on sculpture are drawn from his extensive correspondence and contributions to “Blast”, the vorticist magazine. Much of the narration is drawn from the artists writings on his art.

results.title: Hennessy's holiday
results.brief_description: The visit to Melbourne of Hennessy, a 180-pound St. Bernard dog. He sees the Botanical Gardens, the Sidney Myer Music Bowl, and the Shrine, and takes a run around the M.C.G. After intensive grooming he wins a prize at the Royal Melbourne Show, the takes a ride on the “Mightie Mouse” [sic], and he also enjoys a ride on Puffing Billy and a spin on the bay in a speedboat. A modelling appointment, having his portrait drawn by a cartoonist, and an appearance on ‘In Melbourne Tonight’ help make his visit a memorable one for all.
